list_definition.definition: the place where two or more things join

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The plumber tightened up all the joints in the pipes.

list_definition.definition: a part of the body where two bones meet but are able to move in the manner of eg a hinge

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The shoulders, elbows, wrists, hips, knees, and ankles are joints.

list_definition.definition: a piece of meat for cooking containing a bone

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A leg of mutton is a fairly large joint.
the joint efforts of the whole team.

list_definition.definition: shared by, or belonging to, two or more

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She and her husband have a joint bank account.

list_definition.definition: to divide (an animal etc for cooking) at the, or into, joints

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Joint the chicken before cooking it.
